Comment: Hello my fellow chess playing fans.I  would like to share this game with you.My opponent lost this game in way i once did in a bad habit i once did a lot.Hopefully i have broken this habit.It waspointed out to me and worked on  by my friend ,trachess,THE GREATEST CHESS PLAYER I EVER KNOWN.I dedicate this annotation to him.Okay here we go.I OPEN WITH E4
Standard e5 response.The e5 response has caused me trouble in past,i have been victim of "fools mate".This is what i try to set up.
Opponent counters with Nf6 maybe thinks i setting up for bishop and queen attack.Which i was going to do
Nf3 so i can castle next
Here is where my opponent  starts to lose game.Attacking to quickly with not enough development.Been guity of this mistake also.

Spooking cowboy(PLEASE FORGIVE HALLOWEEN  REFERANCE LOL) Looking back i also could have went d3 and started chain then he would have possibly went Ng3 sacficing Ng3 if i had went h2xNg3.If i had done this he would have hole in wall and he would have walked in withQ and Bc8.Or if for some reason i left Ng3 he could have Ng3xRf1
RETREAT!!!His development now in real trouble.If you notice i have a lot of pressure on center
Bring out other cowboy.Riding hard toward victory
Admit this  is a good pin.But notice what i do next
Expected i am now 2 pieces down.But Bf3 has no backup.Some say this is piece for piece.But to what advantage?What was that old saying of a thousand cuts?
Cancel Bf3 like a stamp.I am now better developed and only 8 moves into game.
He moves Be7 backing up Nf6
Pin.Also i am setting up for the kill with both bishops and Queen.Nf6 is in my way my only problem.

Okay major blunder here.I believe he was thinking i would move  Bg5 because Be7 is backed up with queen and king.But he did not look at whole board.Been guilty of this myself.His king in my crosshairs.

BANG!!!Qxf7 backed up by Bc4 and Bg5.Kinda like a arrowhead huh?Under development and fruitless unsupported early attack cost game for my opponent.I hope you have enjoyed this annotation and possibly learned something.As always postive feedback accepted,negative tolerated.Have a nice day!
